p: PCA of free 2′-OMTase, 2′-OMTase-Dolutegravir complex and 2′-OMTase-Bictegravir complex depicted that the protein, as well as the protein-drug complexes, were occupying almost equal conformational space (see Figure 10). Trace of the covariance matrix for 2′-OMTase, 2′-OMTase-Dolutegravir complex and 2′-OMTase-Bictegravir complex was found to be 106.463 nm 2, 123.878 nm 2 and 117.187 nm 2, respectively. Together with all of the MD simulation analysis, PCA supported that Dolutegravir and Bictegravir could be the most promising drugs capable of inhibiting the function of 2′-OMTase.
